title: The challenge of getting arsenic out of drinking water - RN Drive - ABC Radio National (Australian Broadcasting Corporation)
text:
Image: Arsenic filtering tank systems in Vietnam. (Supplied/UTS) 
It's estimated that more than 140,000 people in more than 70 countries around the world are exposed to unsafe levels of arsenic in drinking water. 
A team of engineers from the University of Technology Sydney have won the Technology Against Poverty prize for designing a new filtration system. 
The filter uses local materials and labour to remove arsenic from water in a way that is safe and sustainable.
